creator: ne01026@shark.2a.pl
text:
W3C Link Checker: http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/env.html says:

Line: 97 http://cgi-spec.golux.com/

Status: 500 Can't connect to cgi-spec.golux.com:80 (connect: No route to host)

This is a server side problem. Check the URI. 

 

I recommend importing that thing from Web archive (it is down since 2006) and hosting a copy at Apache (since Apache HTTP daemon explicitly depends on it).  Alternatively Apache documentation could cease to mention the existence of the document as a separate specification because this specification is private — it is not endorsed by any standards body — and just describe things as their are implemented.  
My efforts to contact the domain owner of golux.com have been fruitless so far.
A similar documentation is present at <URL:http://hoohoo.ncsa.illinois.edu/cgi/env.html>, as already referenced by another page.
creator: ne01026@shark.2a.pl
wrowe@apache.org
ne01026@shark.2a.pl
text: Apache documentation failing to mention Apache RFC?  What a shame.  Both places should be fixed then.

creator: poirier@pobox.com
text: The links have been updated in the 2.2 and trunk documentation.
